etymology.description: Pictogram of an oven -> phonetic 虍 (hū, "tiger") added + semantic 田 ("oven") + semantic 皿 ("vessel") = shaped oven character -> simplified to 卢 (lú) in cursive script
etymology.interpretation: The character originally depicted an oven, which was represented in bronze inscriptions with 虍 (hū, "tiger") for phonetic value and both 田 and 皿 indicating cooking or containment. It was later simplified to 卢 (lú) in cursive script, while its original meaning shifted to be represented by 爐.
etymology.simplification: 卢 is a cursive shorthand of 盧 (lú), adopting a simpler form while retaining phonetic similarity.

examples.chinese: 我住在破旧的卢(我住在破舊的卢)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhù zài pòjiù de lú.
examples.english: I live in a dilapidated hut.

examples.chinese: 夜深人静时(夜深人靜時)，小卢散发着温暖的光芒(小卢散發著溫暖的光芒)。
examples.pinyin: Yè shēn rén jìng shí, xiǎo lú sànfā zhe wēnnuǎn de guāngmáng.
examples.english: When the night is deep and quiet, the little hut exudes a warm glow.
